pages.text: The most essential attribute that one can always spot when encountering a respectable witch is the pointed hat. Venturing out without it is unthinkable; potions turn out abominable, and rituals fail, showing disrespect to the sorcerer who hasn't bothered to acquire this charming wardrobe item yet. Fortunately, crafting it is not difficult.

pages.title: Crafting
pages.text: The pointed hat, a headgear of a true sorcerer, must be crafted from $(l:components/enchanted_leather)tanned enchanted leather$(). Simply sew it correctly with $(l:components/bat_wing)bat wings$() and adorn it with a buckle made of $(l:components/cursed_gold)cursed gold$(). Why cursed gold? Because.

pages.title: Features
pages.text: Crafted in this manner, the hat is actually quite primitive. Apart from the enchanted leather, no magic was applied during its creation process, thus it does not possess a wide range of special magical properties inherent to more advanced headwear worn by seasoned witches and warlocks.

pages.title: Features
pages.text: Nevertheless, it has a couple of features. First and foremost, it is a fashionable accessory in wizarding circles, allowing other connoisseurs to judge your experience and level of power. $(br2)Moreover, wearing this hat during rituals reduces the risk of side effects in case control over the process is lost.
